title: Bitcoin to See Additional $330B of Corporate Treasury Inflows by 2029: Bernstein
short_summary: Corporate treasury buying of bitcoin could reach $330 billion by the end of 2029, broker Bernstein says. Strategy (MSTR) is likely to be the largest buyer, with an additional $124 billion of the world's largest crypto
long_summary: Corporate treasury buying of bitcoin (BTC) could reach $330 billion by the end of 2029, broker Bernstein says. Strategy (MSTR) is likely to be the largest buyer, with an additional $124 billion of the world's largest crypto, in the broker's bull case. The company led by Michael Saylor announced a further $21 billion at-the-market common stock offering last week to buy more bitcoin. Public companies now own ~2.4% of the bitcoin supply, or about 720,000 BTC.

title: Bitcoin Treasury Firms' 'Dry Powder' Could Push Prices Up Significantly: NYDIG
short_summary: New research from NYDIG points to the “dry powder” in the form of share issuance potential among bitcoin treasury companies. If these companies take advantage of their elevated equity valuations to raise new funds and buy more bitcoin,
long_summary: New research from NYDIG points to the “dry powder” in the form of share issuance potential among bitcoin treasury companies. If these companies take advantage of their elevated equity valuations to raise new funds and buy more bitcoin, it could trigger a significant upward move in the market. This market dynamic has gained new urgency following the launch of Twenty One, a bitcoin accumulation vehicle backed by Tether, Bitfinex and Cantor Fitzgerald. Across the sector, 69 public companies hold around $69.6 billion worth of bitcoin.

title: Chainlink to Start New Community Rewards Program for LINK Stakers
short_summary: Chainlink is rolling out a new community rewards program to incentivize participation in its ecosystem. The program, called Chainlink Rewards, allows projects based on the network to reward eligible Chainlink node operators and community members who help secure the network
long_summary: Chainlink is rolling out a new community rewards program to incentivize participation in its ecosystem. The program, called Chainlink Rewards, allows those projects based on the network to reward eligible Chainlink node operators and community members who help secure the network. The first batch of SXT tokens, consisting of 100 million SXT, will become claimable by eligible historical and active LINK Stakers on May 8. No details have yet been shared about upcoming reward partners or the long-term schedule of the program as of Monday.

title: Bitcoin’s Support at $88.8K in Focus After Trendline Break; XRP Eyes Death Cross: Technical Analysis
short_summary: Bitcoin fell 1.5% on Sunday (UTC), diving out of a trendline connecting lows reached on April 9 and April 20. $88,800 could serve as a key support level, having previously capped upward moves on March 24
long_summary: Bitcoin fell 1.5% on Sunday (UTC), diving out of a trendline connecting lows reached on April 9 and April 20. $88,800 could serve as a key support level, having previously capped upward moves on March 24 and April 2. XRP's recovery from April 7 lows has run out of steam, too, with prices falling back below the 50-day simple moving average (SMA) The impending death cross, against the backdrop of the overall downward trend since mid-January, raises the risk of a deeper sell-off.

title: Bitcoin Could Slide to $90K as BTC Traders Eye Fed Meeting
short_summary: Bitcoin (BTC) slipped below $95,000 on Monday, with traders now eyeing a possible retreat to $90,000 or lower. The pullback follows a strong two-week rally, during which BTC briefly pushed past $98
long_summary: Bitcoin (BTC) slipped below $95,000 on Monday, with traders now eyeing a possible retreat to $90,000 or lower. The pullback follows a strong two-week rally, during which BTC briefly pushed past $98,000. Traders eye developments in ongoing U.S.-China tariff talks, and await the Federal Reserve's policy meeting later this week. The Fed is widely expected to leave rates steady on Wednesday, but traders will monitor comments for economic projections and clarity on future rate cuts.
